subject: RE: [junit] Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test

messageBody:
I think it would be useful in certain cases, sort of
like "make -k" (keep going if an error is found).

Although sometimes continuing isn't helpful because
the later assertions assume the previous ones
succeeded (just like a syntax error can throw the
parser/compiler out of sync), that's not always the
case and some people like to work in a batch mode:
generate a list of problems, fix a bunch of them,
re-test, ...

This could possibly be an option to the test runner,
just like the make flag, but as someone else pointed
out you can do this via separate test methods.
